Rofl, I have no idea what you did. Your client should have that declared otherwise a lot of objects shouldn’t work. Try putting aStringArray786 = null;

In private final void method573()
In class46

item.source: How to add objects to your client

item.title: How to add objects to your client
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Hi guys, this is my first tut.

Step one:
Firstly we need a model.
Find an object model that is .gzip or .dat(if you use model preloading)
If you want to make your own model follow Cj’s tut in the stickies in model section.

Add this model to your models folder.

Now the ints.

Open class46.java in your client.

I used these ints to replace a bed with a bed that was smaller so I could pinpoint the coords.

if(i == 5564)//This is the id of the Object (Not the model) { //Credits to Tatemo for working this out// class46.aStringArray786 = new String[5];//This makes a new first click string class46.aStringArray786[1] = "Shop";//This is the first click name //Credits to Cj for all Below// class46.anInt744 = 1;//This is the size class46.anInt761 = 1;//This is also the size class46.aBoolean778 = true;//Im not quite sure what these are class46.aBoolean767 = true;//Something to do with clipping class46.aBoolean762 = false;//And stuff like that play around class46.aBoolean769 = false;//To find out what they do class46.anIntArray773 = new int[1];//Says that there is a new Model id class46.anIntArray773[0] = 0;//The model id }

Basically the code above means that for the Object 5564 I am going to give it an option to Buy from it and Changing the model to 0 (Dwarf head), I am also making it 1x1 square large.

Hope I helped and please don’t say I leeched from Cj because I know I did for all but one part the part that no amount of searching found for me. This…
class46.aStringArray786 = new String[5];//This makes a new first click string
class46.aStringArray786[1] = “Shop”;//This is the first click name

I little tut on the side for those who want extra knowledge.
You will notice in class46, class5 and class8 there are some codes like this…

Class8:

anInt174 = 0; aString170 = null; aByteArray178 = null; anIntArray156 = null; anIntArray160 = null; anInt181 = 12000; anInt190 = 0; anInt198 = 0; anInt204 = 0; anInt169 = 0; anInt194 = 0; anInt199 = -1; aBoolean176 = false; anInt155 = 1; aBoolean161 = false; aStringArray168 = null; aStringArray189 = null; anInt165 = -1; anInt188 = -1; aByte205 = 0; anInt200 = -1; anInt164 = -1; aByte154 = 0; anInt185 = -1; anInt162 = -1; anInt175 = -1; anInt166 = -1; anInt197 = -1; anInt173 = -1; anIntArray193 = null; anIntArray201 = null; anInt179 = -1; anInt163 = -1; anInt167 = 128; anInt192 = 128; anInt191 = 128; anInt196 = 0; anInt184 = 0; anInt202 = 0;

Class5:

anInt55 = -1; anInt57 = -1; anInt58 = -1; anInt59 = -1; anInt61 = -1; anInt63 = 9; anInt64 = 1834; anInt67 = -1; aByte68 = 1; anInt69 = 9; anInt71 = -1; anInt75 = -1; anInt77 = -1; aLong78 = -1L; anInt79 = 32; aBoolean81 = false; anInt83 = -1; aBoolean84 = true; anInt86 = 128; aBoolean87 = true; anInt90 = -1; anInt91 = 128; aBoolean93 = false; anInt96 = -1;

Class46:

anIntArray773 = null; anIntArray776 = null; aString739 = null; aByteArray777 = null; anIntArray784 = null; anIntArray747 = null; anInt744 = 1; anInt761 = 1; aBoolean767 = true; aBoolean757 = true; aBoolean778 = false; aBoolean762 = false; aBoolean769 = false; aBoolean764 = false; anInt781 = -1; anInt775 = 16; aByte737 = 0; aByte742 = 0; aStringArray786 = null; anInt746 = -1; anInt758 = -1; aBoolean751 = false; aBoolean779 = true; anInt748 = 128; anInt772 = 128; anInt740 = 128; anInt768 = 0; anInt738 = 0; anInt745 = 0; anInt783 = 0; aBoolean736 = false; aBoolean766 = false; anInt760 = -1; anInt774 = -1; anInt749 = -1; anIntArray759 = null;

Now what you may or may not realise is that these are actually the variables you can put inside the ints.
The problem is no one as far as I know knows what all of them mean.
But I think there can be some big improvements/changes in ints if we learn what each of these are/do.
Now i’m sure you can see how I worked out how to give my object a first click.
I looked at the one from class46 and went in class8 the variable that is first click item ends with an =null and is the towards the end so I assumed the variable in class46 would be towards the end and end with = null and I got it first try. For those who are blind here it is: aStringArray786 = null;
Straight out of class46.
Again I hope this helped you learn more about object ints and Ints in general and the possibilities for them.

Read full topic
item.source: How to add objects to your client
